subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Accelerated Hindi
description: First part of the accelerated first-year sequence. Speclang  53A and 53B complete the first year in two quarters rather than three quarters. Fulfills the University Language requirement. Emphasis is on the accelerated development of language proficiency, listening comprehension, reading and writing skills through conversational practice and in-class/online writing activities. Discussion of culture and social life is integrated into daily language learning activities through authentic materials and students will be interacting and integrating different aspects of language and culture live and virtually.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Language Specials
description: Prerequisite:  Consent of instructor

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Cherokee, First Quarter
description: First quarter of a three-quarter beginning sequence. Course emphasizes developing effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Cherokee culture.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Cherokee, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 100A. Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Cherokee. Course emphasizes continued development of effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Cherokee culture. Prerequisite: SPECLANG100A or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Cherokee, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 100B. Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Cherokee. Course emphasizes developing effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Cherokee culture. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 100B or consent of instructor. Completion of 100C fulfills the University  language requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Nahuatl, First Quarter
description: First quarter of a three-quarter beginning sequence. Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Nahuatl. Course emphasizes developing effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Nahuatl culture.Some knowledge of Spanish is useful.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Nahuatl, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG101A. Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction,conducted primarily in Nahuatl. Course emphasizes continued development of effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and  sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Nahuatl culture. Some knowledge of Spanish is useful. Prerequisite: SPECLANG101 A or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Nahuatl, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 101B. Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Nahuatl. Course emphasizes continued development of effective communication at a basic level, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening in everyday situations. Nahuatl culture. Some knowledge of Spanish is useful. Prerequisite: SPECLANG101B or placement test.Completion of 101C fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year  Nahuatl, First Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Nahuatl. Continuation of SPECLANG 101 sequence integrating language and culture, with emphasis on developing proficiency in oral and written discourse. Targeted functional abilities include socio culturally appropriate language  in formal contexts. Prerequisite: Placement Test, SPECLANG101 A,B,C

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second -Year Nahuatl, Second Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Najuatl. Continuation of SPECLANG102A sequence integrating language and culture, with emphasis on developing proficiency in oral and written discourse. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socio culturally appropriate language in formal and informal contexts. Prerequisite: Placement Test or  SPECLANG102A

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Nahuatl, Third Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted primarily in Nahuatl. Continuation of SPECLANG102B sequence integrating language and culture, with emphasis on developing proficiency in oral and written discourse. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socio culturally appropriate language in formal and informal contexts. Prerequisite: Placement Test, SPECLANG102B

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third- year Nahuatl- First Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted in Najuatl.Course focuses on developing advanced proficiency in oral and written Nahuatl. Emphasis on functional abilities that integrate language and culture in formal, informal, academic and professional contexts. Prerequisite- Placement test or Speclang 102C

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third- Year Nahuatl, Second Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted  in Najuatl.Course focuses on developing advanced proficiency in oral and written Nahuatl. Emphasis on functional abilities that integrate language and culture in formal, informal, academic and professional contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third- Year Nahuatl,Third Quarter
description: Distance learning combined with periodic on-site instruction, conducted  in Najuatl.Course focuses on developing advanced proficiency in oral and written Nahuatl. Emphasis on functional abilities that integrate language and culture in formal, informal, academic and professional contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Reading Sanskrit
description: Focus of this class is the practice of reading Sanskrit. Different texts are read each term, selected largely to fit the needs and interests of the students. Knowledge of Sanskrit grammar required. This course does not fulfill the University Language Requirement. Repeatable for credit up to 12 units.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Cherokee, First Quarter
description: The course is the first in a three-quarter sequence of second-year language courses. It focuses on communicating in the language while students are developing more advanced skills in describing, narrating in all time frames, making comparisons and expressing opinions. The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Cherokee culture. Prerequisite: First Year Cherokee sequence or recent placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Cherokee,Second Quarter
description: The course is the second in a three-quarter sequence of second-year language courses. It focuses on communicating in the language while students are developing more advanced skills in describing, narrating in all time frames, making comparisons and expressing opinions. The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Cherokee culture. Prerequisite: Speclang 108A or recent placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Cherokee, Third Quarter
description: The course is the third in a three-quarter sequence of second-year language courses. It focuses on communicating in the language while students are further developing more advanced skills in describing, narrating in all time frames, making comparisons and expressing opinions. The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Cherokee culture. Prerequisite: Speclang 108B or recent placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Intro to Uyghur
description: The course emphasizes developing effective communication at a basic level, in every day situations, covering grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening.  Culture elements are an essential part.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Uyghur First Quarter
description: First Year First quarter Uyghur is the first course in a three quarter sequence.  Focus on speaking writing and listening while developing students' communicative skills in Uyghur. Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts related to daily activities within traditional Uyghur cultural contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Uyghur, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 115A. First Year second quarter Uyghur is the second course in a three quarter sequence.  Focus on an Interactive approach further expanding the ability to express concepts related to daily activities within traditional Uyghur cultural contexts.Prerequisite: SPECLANG 115A or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Uyghur, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 115B. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 115B.  Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Uyghur, First Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 115C. Grammar structures and vocabulary through authentic materials. Cultural proficiency. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 115C. Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Samoan, First quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Samoan. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Samoan, second quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Samoan.  Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Samoan, third quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Samoan.  Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.  This is the third course in the three part series.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Inupiaq, First Quarter
description: This  course  focuses  on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Inupiaq. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year  Inupiaq, Second Quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Inupiaq. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Inupiaq, third quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Inupiaq. The completion of this course fulfils the University language requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Serbian, First Quarter
description: First Year First quarter Serbian is the first course in a three-quarter sequence. The course emphasizes developing basic level communication skills using daily life topics and cultural life in Serbia. Grammatical structures and vocabulary are introduced through interpersonal, interpretive, and presentational modes of communication.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Tibetan, First Quarter
description: The course is designed to develop reading competence in Classical Tibetan. The emphasis is on vocabulary building, grammar, reading comprehension, and translation of materials pertinent to Tibetan religion, literature, history, and culture.

sections.notes: This class section has been cancelled!

subject: SPECLANG
title: First Year Tibetan, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of 122A- The course is designed to develop reading competence in Classical Tibetan. The emphasis is on vocabulary building, grammar, reading comprehension, and translation of materials pertinent to Tibetan religion, literature, history, and culture.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First- Year Khmer, First Quarter
description: The course is the first in a three-quarter sequence of first year language courses. No previous knowledge of Khmer is required. It focuses on introducing Khmer in the context of formal and informal communication.  The course content is centers on topics of daily life activities and emphasizes descriptions of self and community, short narratives, expression of feelings and simple questions and answers. Khmer  culture is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Khmer, Second Quarter
description: This is the second course in a three-quarter sequence of first year language courses. It focuses on further introducing Khmer in the context of formal and informal communication. The course content centers on topics of daily life activities and emphasizes descriptions of self and community, short narratives, expression of feelings and simple questions and answers. Khmer culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 125A or a placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Khmer,Third Quarter
description: This is the third course in a three-quarter sequence of first year language courses. It focuses on further introducing Khmer in the context of formal and informal communication. title: First-Year Dutch, First Quarter

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Slovenian, First Quarter
description: First quarter of the first year, in a three-quarter sequence.  Students learn to use basic vocabulary, grammatical structures, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening. Introduction to Slovenia and its cultures.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Slovenian, Third Quarter
description: Third quarter of a three-quarter first year sequence. Students develop proficiency in speaking, reading, writing, and listening for effective communication. Beginning competence in Slovenian-speaking cultures. Prerequisite SPECLANG 132B or placement test.Completion of this course fulfills the language requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Advanced Dutch Conversation
description: Advanced Dutch Conversation requires completion of the third-year sequence, or consent of instructor. This 2-units course focuses on oral communication. Speaking skills and functions include narration, description, supporting opinions, and hypothesizing about current events and issues in Dutch speaking regions around the world. Students are invited to bring texts, audio/video material, and to suggest topics of conversation.

title: Third-Year Dutch, First Quarter

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Navajo
description: The Second-year first quarter Navajo course requires completion of the First year sequence. Students engage in meaningful intercultural communication in a variety of contexts using socially and culturally appropriate forms. Prerequisite: Placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Navajo, second quarter
description: The Second-year second quarter.The second year second quarter Navajo course requires completion of the second year-first quarter Navajo . Students engage in meaningful intercultural communication in a variety of contexts using socially and culturally appropriate forms.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Hittite, First Quarter
description: This is a full class on the Hittite language of ancient Anatolia.  After first learning the basics of Hittite grammar, vocabulary, and the cuneiform script, the class will then start reading various real texts.  Since Hittite is an Indo-European language it is thus related to Sanskrit, Greek, Latin and English.  Besides the language itself the class will also cover aspects of Hittite history, religion, mythology, literature, and law.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Hittite, Second Quarter
description: This is a full class on the Hittite language of ancient Anatolia.  After first learning the basics of Hittite grammar, vocabulary, and the cuneiform script, the class will then start reading various real texts.  Since Hittite is an Indo-European language it is thus related to Sanskrit, Greek, Latin and English.  Besides the language itself the class will also cover aspects of Hittite history, religion, mythology, literature, and law.  Continuation of 140A

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Hawaiian, First Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 189C. The course is the first in a three-quarter sequence of second-year language courses. It focuses on communicating in the language while students are developing more advanced skills in describing, narrating in all time frames, making comparisons and expressing opinions. The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Hawaiian culture. Prerequisite: First Year Hawaiian sequence or placement test.

The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Hawaiian culture. Prerequisite: First Year Hawaiian sequence or recent placement test.

The course uses written and oral materials within informal and formal contexts and emphasizes a deeper understanding of the Hawaiian culture. Prerequisite: First Year Hawaiian sequence or  placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third Year K'iche, First Quarter
description: This is a long distance course.  It is designed to develop reading competence in K'iche'. Focus on advanced level in reading K'iche' authentic materials pertinent to history, literature and culture. Emphasis is on vocabulary building, reading comprehension, and translation. Previous knowledge of the language is required.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Modern Greek for Heritage Learners
description: The course is designed with focus on advancing communication skills and proficiency while building on previous linguistic and cultural knowledge.  Emphasis is given on current events and topics of general interest, from personal to social and professional.  Students work individually and collaboratively to communicate in oral as well as written form by using authentic texts, films and web based audiovisual materials. Instructor's consent required.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Modern Greek for Heritage Language Learners, First Quarter
description: The first course in the three quarter sequence for Modern Greek Heritage Learners focuses on advancing communication skills and proficiency while building on previous linguistic and cultural knowledge. Emphasis on current events and topics of general interest, from personal to social and professional. Students work individually and collaboratively to communicate in oral as well as written forms by using authentic texts, films and web based audiovisual materials. Prerequisite Placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Modern Greek for Heritage Language Learners, Second Quarter
description: The second course in the three quarter sequence for Modern Greek Heritage Learners focuses on advancing communication skills and proficiency while building on previous linguistic and cultural knowledge. Emphasis on current events and topics of general interest, from personal to social and professional. Students work individually and collaboratively to communicate in oral as well as written forms by using authentic texts, films and web based audiovisual materials. Prerequisite SPECLANG 215A or Placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Modern Greek for Heritage Language Learners, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 215B. The third course in the sequence for Modern Greek Heritage Learners focuses on advancing communication skills and proficiency while building on previous linguistic and cultural knowledge. Emphasis on current events and topics of general interest, from personal to social and professional. Students work individually and collaboratively to communicate in oral as well as written forms by using authentic texts, films and web based audiovisual materials. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 215B or Placement test  Prerequisite: SPECLANG 215A.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Urdu, First Quarter
description: First Year Urdu will introduce students to the Urdu alphabet (Nastaliq script); to pronunciation and intonation; to basic conversation patterns; and to the elements of spelling, reading, and writing in Urdu. It will cover basic grammar of modern standard Urdu. As part of this course, students will learn popular Urdu songs, watch films and video clips, and become familiar with culture of Urdu speaking people. They will also have exciting opportunities to make their own audio and video recordings to improve their pronunciation, work with Web-based and multi-media materials, and to go on one or more field trips. By the end of year, students will have acquired a basic vocabulary of 800-1000 words, and will be able to generate and interpret several types of simple sentences in simple conversation as well as write in a variety of communication contexts

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Urdu, Second Quarter
description: Grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening. Urdu culture.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Urdu, Third Quarter
description: Grammatical structures, vocabulary, and sentence patterns through speaking, reading, writing, and listening. Urdu culture.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Urdu, first quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Urdu. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Urdu, second quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Urdu. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Urdu, third quarter
description: Focus is on speaking, writing, reading, and listening abilities in Urdu. Interactive approach enables students to express concepts and develop communicative competence at the basic level. Cultural context is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Advanced Readings in Vietnamese
description: The course is designed to develop reading competence in Vietnamese. Students will reach advanced proficiency in reading authentic Vietnamese materials pertinent to history and culture.  Texts will include prose and poetry pieces from Vietnamese literature, media, and historical documents. The emphasis is on vocabulary building, reading comprehension, and translation. An intermediate level of Vietnamese is required. (Prereq.  Speclang 224C or placement exam)

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Vietnamese, First Quarter
description: Third Year First Quarter Vietnamese is the first course in a three quarter sequence. Focus of the course is on developing communication and presentation skills in Vietnamese using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite 151C or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Vietnamese, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 224A. Third Year Second Quarter Vietnamese is the second  course in a three quarter sequence. Focus of the course is on developing communication and presentation skills in Vietnamese using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools further enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite224A or placement testPrerequisite: SPECLANG 224A or consent of instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Vietnamese, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 224B. Third Year Third  Quarter Vietnamese is the third course in a three quarter sequence. Focus of the course is on developing communication and presentation skills in Vietnamese using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio-visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools further enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite: 224B or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Khmer, First Quarter
description: Second Year Khmer is intended for students who can already speak Khmer at a "survival" level  (discuss topics such as home, family, food, traveling, work, health) and have basic knowledge of the writing system (able to read short narratives, simple folk tales; and write letters and other types of information based on personal experience). In this course, the first of a three-quarter sequence, students will learn to discuss topics such as Khmer Buddhism, proverbs, and news media using more formal language and educated vocabulary. They will also learn to read (and write about) increasingly sophisticated texts including folk tales and newspaper articles. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 125C or a placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Khmer, Second Quarter
description: SPECLANG 226B Second Year second quarter Khmer is the second course in a three quarter sequence. We'll focus on a spoken and written overview of Khmer history, with the goal of participating in discussions of history with educated native speakers. Students will also begin to read a Khmer novel, and design and research an independent study project. Prerequisite: Second year first quarter Khmer or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second Year Khmer, Third Quarter
description: Second Year third quarter Khmer is the final course in a three quarter sequence. Students will finish reading and discussing a Khmer novel, be introduced to traditional Khmer poetry, and finish the independent study project begun in Winter quarter, including making an oral presentation of their research in Khmer. Emphasis will be on formal grammar and vocabulary in both spoken and written applications. Prerequisite: Second year second quarter Khmer. No new students will normally be allowed to join the course this quarter.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Slovenian, third Quarter
description: TBD

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Haitian Creole, First Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 134C. Expands students' proficiency in Haitian Creole language and culture through various texts and multimedia. Students will continue to learn the language with an emphasis on communicative and interactive classroom activities. Prerequisite: Placement Test or SPECLANG 134C.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Readings in Slovenian
description: The purpose of the class is to deepen students' reading abilities of a variety of original Slovenian text for research purposes. Prerequisite: A placement test and consent of the instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Lakota, First Quarter
description: First Year Lakota First Quarter is the first course in a three quarter sequence. Focus on speaking writing and listening while developing communicative skills in Lakota.Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts related to daily activities within traditional Lakota cultural contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Lakota, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 247A. First Year Lakota Second  Quarter is the second course in a three quarter sequence. Focus on speaking writing and listening while further developing communicative skills in Lakota Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts related to daily activities within traditional. Prerequisite SPECLANG247A or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Lakota, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 247B. First Year Lakota Third  Quarter is the third course in a three quarter sequence.Focus on speaking writing and listening while further developing communicative skills in Lakota Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts related to daily activities within traditional. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 247B or placement test.Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Lakota, First Quarter
description: Continuation of 247 ABC. Focus on speaking writing and listening while developing students' communicative skills in Lakota. Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts on a variety of social and cultural topics within traditional Lakota cultural contexts. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 247C or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Lakota
description: prerequisite-speclang 248A Focus on speaking writing and listening while developing students communicative skills in Lakota. Interactive approach emphasizing the ability to express concepts on a variety of social and cultural topics within traditional Lakota cultural contexts.Prerequisite: SPECLANG 248A or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Lakota, third Quarter
description: Continuation of 248B. Focus on displaying an increased ability in reinforcing and expanding the scope of communication in Lakota, including all skills. Emphasis on engagement in a wide range of context-specific and culturally appropriate interactions in Lakota. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 248B or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Romanian, First Quarter
description: First Year Romanian First  Quarter is the first course in a three quarter sequence. Focus on introducing Romanian in the context of formal and informal communication. Emphasis on topics of daily life activities and descriptions of self and community, short narratives, expression of feelings and simple questions and answers. Romanian culture is an essential part of the course.

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Romanian, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 250A. First Year Romanian Second  Quarter is the second course in a three quarter sequence Focus on further introducing Romanian in the context of formal and informal communication. Emphasis on topics of daily life activities and descriptions of self and community, short narratives, expression of feelings and simple questions and answers. Romanian culture is an essential part of the course.Prerequisite: SPECLANG 250A or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: First-Year Romanian, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 250B. First Year Romanian Third  Quarter is the third course in a three quarter sequence. Focus on further introducing Romanian in the context of formal and informal communication. Emphasis on topics of daily life activities and descriptions of self and community, short narratives,expression of feelings and simple questions and answers. Romanian culture is an essential part of the course.Prerequisite SPECLANG 250B or placement test.  Completion of this course fulfills the University Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Romanian, First Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 250C. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 250C or consent of instructor. Fulfills the University Foreign Language Requirement.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Romanian, Second Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 251A. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 251A or consent of instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Second-Year Romanian, Third Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANTG 251B. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 251B or consent of instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Romanian, First Quarter
description: The course focuses on advancing skills of previous years. Emphasis on communication within personal, academic and professional contexts. Students use specific tools that allow for better accuracy and fluency. Topics broaden from the concrete to the abstract while a thematic approach becomes  the platform for introducing cultural practices and perspectives. Continuation of SPECLANG 251C. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 251C or consent of instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Romanian, Thrid Quarter
description: Continuation of SPECLANG 252B. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 252B or consent of instructor.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Greek, First Quarter
description: Third Year Modern Greek First Quarter is the first course in a three quarter sequence. Focus of the course is on developing communication and presentation skills in Modern Greek using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio-visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course.  Prerequisite: SPECLANG 171C or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Greek, Second Quarter
description: Third Year Modern Greek Second  Quarter is the second course in a three quarter sequence.Focus of the course is on developing more advanced communication and presentation skills in Modern Greek using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio-visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite 260Aor placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Modern Greek, Third Quarter
description: Third Year Modern Greek Third Quarter  is the third course in a three quarter sequence. Focus of the course is on developing more advanced communication and presentation skills in Modern Greek using a variety of topics and different contexts. Authentic audio-visual material and use of level appropriate pedagogy tools enhance functional linguistic abilities. Culture is an essential part of the course. Prerequisite 260B or placement test

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Hungarian, First Quarter
description: The Third Year Hungarian is a three-quarter sequence. The course integrates language and culture, emphasizing further developing proficiency in interpersonal, interpretive, and presentational communications. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socio-culturally appropriate language in formal and informal contexts. Prerequisite: SPECLANG182C or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Hungarian, Second Quarter
description: The Third Year Hungarian is a three-quarter sequence. The course integrates language and culture, emphasizing further developing proficiency in interpersonal, interpretive, and presentational communications. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socio-culturally appropriate language in formal and informal contexts. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 265A or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Hungarian, Third Quarter
description: The Third Year Hungarian is a three-quarter sequence. The course integrates language and culture, emphasizing further developing proficiency in interpersonal, interpretive, and presentational communications. Targeted functional abilities include presentational and socio-culturally appropriate language in formal and informal contexts. Prerequisite: SPECLANG 265C or placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Readings in Hungarian
description: The purpose of the class is to deepen students' reading abilities of a variety of original Hungarian text for research purposes. Prerequisite: completing the three years Hungarian language sequence or proving equivalent knowledge based on language testing. Pre-requisite- 3rd year Hungarian or a placement test.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Fourth-Year Hungarian, First Quarter
description: Continuation of Speclang 265C.  The course is the continuity of three academic years of learning Hungarian or students' ability to prove their proficiency by testing. Learnings will build on the previous quarters, including conversation, writing, reading, and contemporary Hungary's social and cultural issues.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Fourth-Year Hungarian, 2nd Quarter
description: The course is the continuity of three academic years of learning Hungarian or students' ability to prove their proficiency by testing. Learnings will build on the previous quarters, including conversation, writing, reading, and contemporary Hungary's social and cultural issues.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Quechua, First Quarter
description: This is a third year first quarter course in Quechua language and culture, offered as a three quarter sequence. The course focuses on developing fluency and accuracy as students immerse in the use of the language in a range of situations. The course uses a thematic approach. Topics integrate elements of Quechua culture, review of relevant grammar concepts, and opportunities to use the language in real-world cultural contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Quechua
description: This is  a third year course in Quechua language and culture, offered as a three quarter sequence. The course focuses on developing fluency and accuracy as students gain practice in the use of the language in a range of situations. The course uses a thematic approach. Topics integrate elements of Quechua culture, review of relevant grammar concepts, and opportunities to use the language in real-world cultural contexts.

subject: SPECLANG
title: Third-Year Quechua, Third Quarter
description: This is a third year course in Quechua language and culture, offered as a three quarter sequence. The course focuses on developing fluency and accuracy as students gain practice in the use of the language in a range of situations. The course uses a thematic approach. Topics integrate elements of Quechua culture, review of relevant grammar concepts, and opportunities to use the language in real-world cultural contexts.

title: Directed Reading
